text: hello I'm David Pogue this week in the

removable hard drive cartridge systems

backup and storage I don't know if my

though I really don't know I'm supposed

it's boring you can even take the words

what do you get borage but you know a

video I'll do everything in my power to

reviewed 3 removable cartridge systems
the iomega Rev the quantum go vault and
the RDX system which is manufactured and
sold by different companies like Dell
imation and others under their own names
the iomega route takes 70 gigabyte
cartridges the RDX system takes
cartridges ranging from 40 to 160 gigs
and the quantum takes cartridges from 40
to 120 gigs each cartridge is actually a
removable hard drive so they're wicked
fast
the thing is they're really expensive
the quantum RDX cartridges cost about
two hundred fifty dollars for 120
gigabyte model you could buy three of
these pocket hard drives for that much
money the companies say yeah but our
cartridges aren't for people therefore
corporations companies with deep pockets
who need unbelievably rugged systems
that are much more reliable than
portable hard drives the quantum and RDX
cartridges can withstand a three foot
drop the concrete the iomega Rev
cartridge can handle three feet onto
carpet
the manufacturers say that their real
target is tape drives which by
comparison are slow baki and expensive
and I'll grant them that these
cartridges flow away tape backup it's
just too bad that the company's priced

reach if they weren't so expensive these

they'd be just what storage systems
